data.title: 3 Things to do in the World Book Day in Alcalá (23rd April)
meta_keywords: the world book day in alcalá
data.meta_description: 3 Things to do in the World Book Day in Alcalá (23rd April): Premio Miguel de Cervantes, Festival de la Palabra and Alcalá Book Fair.
data.meta_site_name: AlcalaNOW | Enjoy Alcalá de Henares like a local would do
data.text:
If there is a day in which Alcalá and books become synonyms it is in this day, the 23th of April, the World Book Day, when multiple events take place in the town to celebrate the tight relationship between Alcalá and literature. We will tell you how to make the best of this special day.

This date, the 23th April, was chosen as the World Book Day by the UNESCO, for being the day in which, in 1616, both Cervantes and Shakespeare died. This is not completely true, since at the time Spain used the Gregorian Calendar, while England used the Julian Calendar, so although both writers died on the same date, Shakespeare actually died 12 days later than Cervantes!.

1. Premio Miguel de Cervantes

Probably the most important event of the day is the award ceremony of the Premio Miguel de Cervantes, for many the most prestigious literary prize for Spanish language writers. Established in 1976, it is awarded annually to an outstanding writer in the Spanish language, independent of their nationality, for their lifetime achievements. Many remarkable writers have won this prize: Borges, Octavio Paz, Gerardo Diego, Carlos Fuentes, Camilo José Cela,…

The ceremony takes place in the Paraninfo of the University of Alcalá, and the Kings of Spain, or recently the Princes, are in charge of giving the prize to the winner. Sadly it is not a public event, but there are always throngs of people in the entrance of the University wishing to see the King and Queen, Princes, Ministers and other well-known public figures.

Here is the list of Laureates in recent years:

2013 – Elena Poniatowska (1932)

2012 – José Manuel Caballero Bonald (1926).

2011 – Nicanor Parra (1914)

2010 – Ana María Matute (1925)

2009 – José Emilio Pacheco (1939-2014)

2008 – Juan Marsé (1933)

2007 – Juan Gelman (1930-2014)

2006 – Antonio Gamoneda (1931)

2005 – Sergio Pitol (1933)

2004 – Rafael Sánchez Ferlosio (1927)

2003 – Gonzalo Rojas (1917 – 2011)

2002 – José Jiménez Lozano (1930)

2001 – Álvaro Mutis (1923 – 2013)

2000 – Francisco Umbral (1932-2007)

2. Festival de la Palabra

El Festival de la Palabra is a “festival” organized by the University of Alcalá to honour not only this very day, but the whole literary month. Events such as exhibitions, cinema or even lectures have their place in the scheduled activities..

Check the information in the webpage of the University of Alcalá

3. Alcalá Book Fair

Another place to buy or just to glance through some books, is the Alcalá Book Fair, which this year celebrates its 33th edition. It is a small book fair, but with a wide range of titles, especially books about Alcalá. The Book Fair is located in Plaza Cervantes and will take place from 25th April to 12th May, with timetable 10:00-14:00 and 17:00-21:00.

This day is also a marvellous day for buying books, since you will have a special 10% discount in bookshops, not only in Alcalá, but in the whole Spain. So, if you have any book in mind, this is the day to buy it!
